segment.source: Offline migration enables the ScanState tool to run inside a different Windows® operating system than the Windows operating system from which ScanState is gathering files and settings.
segment.target: Offline migration enables the ScanState tool to run inside a different Windows® operating system than the Windows operating system from which ScanState is gathering files and settings.

segment.source: There are two primary offline scenarios:
segment.target: There are two primary offline scenarios:

segment.source: The ScanState tool can be run from within Windows PE, gathering files and settings from the offline Windows operating system on that machine.
segment.target: The ScanState tool can be run from within Windows PE, gathering files and settings from the offline Windows operating system on that machine.

segment.source: The ScanState tool can now gather files and settings from the Windows.old directory that is created during Windows installation on a partition that contains a previous installation of Windows.
segment.target: The ScanState tool can now gather files and settings from the Windows.old directory that is created during Windows installation on a partition that contains a previous installation of Windows.

segment.source: For example, the ScanState tool can run in Windows 10, gathering files from a previous Windows 7or Windows 8 installation contained in the Windows.old directory.
segment.target: For example, the ScanState tool can run in Windows 10, gathering files from a previous Windows 7or Windows 8 installation contained in the Windows.old directory.

segment.source: When you use User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 to gather and restore user state, offline migration reduces the cost of deployment by:
segment.target: When you use User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 to gather and restore user state, offline migration reduces the cost of deployment by:

segment.source: In computer-refresh scenarios, migrations from the Windows.old directory reduce complexity by eliminating the need for the ScanState tool to be run before the operating system is deployed.
segment.target: In computer-refresh scenarios, migrations from the Windows.old directory reduce complexity by eliminating the need for the ScanState tool to be run before the operating system is deployed.

segment.source: Also, migrations from the Windows.old directory enable ScanState and LoadState to be run successively.
segment.target: Also, migrations from the Windows.old directory enable ScanState and LoadState to be run successively.

segment.source: When USMT runs in an offline Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) environment, it has better access to the hardware resources.
segment.target: When USMT runs in an offline Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE) environment, it has better access to the hardware resources.

segment.source: This may increase performance on older machines with limited hardware resources and numerous installed software applications.
segment.target: This may increase performance on older machines with limited hardware resources and numerous installed software applications.

segment.source: In scenarios where a machine no longer restarts properly, it might be possible to gather user state with the ScanState tool from within WinPE.
segment.target: In scenarios where a machine no longer restarts properly, it might be possible to gather user state with the ScanState tool from within WinPE.

segment.source: The following user data and settings migrate offline, similar to an online migration:
segment.target: The following user data and settings migrate offline, similar to an online migration:

segment.source: Data and registry keys specified in MigXML
segment.target: Data and registry keys specified in MigXML

segment.source: For exceptions to what you can migrate offline, see What Does USMT Migrate?
segment.target: For exceptions to what you can migrate offline, see What Does USMT Migrate?

segment.source: The following table defines the supported combination of online and offline operating systems in USMT.
segment.target: The following table defines the supported combination of online and offline operating systems in USMT.

segment.source: WinPE 5.0 or greater, with the MSXML library
segment.target: WinPE 5.0 or greater, with the MSXML library

segment.source: It is possible to run the ScanState tool while the drive remains encrypted by suspending Windows BitLocker Drive Encryption before booting into WinPE.
segment.target: It is possible to run the ScanState tool while the drive remains encrypted by suspending Windows BitLocker Drive Encryption before booting into WinPE.

segment.source: For more information, see this Microsoft site.
segment.target: For more information, see this Microsoft site.

segment.source: User-group membership is not preserved during offline migrations.
segment.target: User-group membership is not preserved during offline migrations.

segment.source: You must configure a ProfileControl section in the Config.xml file to specify the groups that the migrated users should be made members of.
segment.target: You must configure a ProfileControl section in the Config.xml file to specify the groups that the migrated users should be made members of.

segment.source: The following example places all migrated users into the Users group:
segment.target: The following example places all migrated users into the Users group:

segment.source: For information about the format of a Config.xml file, see Config.xml File.
segment.target: For information about the format of a Config.xml file, see Config.xml File.

segment.source: An offline migration can either be enabled by using a configuration file on the command line, or by using one of the following command line options:
segment.target: An offline migration can either be enabled by using a configuration file on the command line, or by using one of the following command line options:

segment.source: This command-line option enables the offline-migration mode and requires a path to an Offline.xml configuration file.
segment.target: This command-line option enables the offline-migration mode and requires a path to an Offline.xml configuration file.

segment.source: This command-line option enables the offline-migration mode and starts the migration from the location specified.
segment.target: This command-line option enables the offline-migration mode and starts the migration from the location specified.

segment.source: It is only for use in WinPE offline scenarios where the migration is occurring from a Windows directory.
segment.target: It is only for use in WinPE offline scenarios where the migration is occurring from a Windows directory.

segment.source: This command-line option enables the offline migration mode and starts the migration from the location specified.
segment.target: This command-line option enables the offline migration mode and starts the migration from the location specified.

segment.source: It is only intended to be used in Windows.old migration scenarios, where the migration is occurring from a Windows.old directory.
segment.target: It is only intended to be used in Windows.old migration scenarios, where the migration is occurring from a Windows.old directory.

segment.source: You can use only one of the /offline,/offlineWinDir , or /OfflineWinOld command-line options at a time; USMT does not support using more than one together.
segment.target: You can use only one of the /offline,/offlineWinDir , or /OfflineWinOld command-line options at a time; USMT does not support using more than one together.

segment.source: The following system environment variables are necessary in the scenarios outlined below.
segment.target: The following system environment variables are necessary in the scenarios outlined below.

segment.source: Full path to a working directory
segment.target: Full path to a working directory

segment.source: Required when USMT binaries are located on read-only media, which does not support the creation of log files or temporary storage.
segment.target: Required when USMT binaries are located on read-only media, which does not support the creation of log files or temporary storage.

segment.source: To set the system environment variable, at a command prompt type the following:
segment.target: To set the system environment variable, at a command prompt type the following:

segment.source: While operating offline, this environment variable defines the architecture of the offline system, if the system does not match the WinPE and Scanstate.exe architecture.
segment.target: While operating offline, this environment variable defines the architecture of the offline system, if the system does not match the WinPE and Scanstate.exe architecture.

segment.source: This environment variable enables the 32-bit ScanState application to gather data from a computer with 64-bit architecture, or the 64-bit ScanState application to gather data from a computer with 32-bit architecture.
segment.target: This environment variable enables the 32-bit ScanState application to gather data from a computer with 64-bit architecture, or the 64-bit ScanState application to gather data from a computer with 32-bit architecture.

segment.source: This is required when auto-detection of the offline architecture doesn’t function properly, for example, when the source system is running a 64-bit version of Windows XP.
segment.target: This is required when auto-detection of the offline architecture doesn’t function properly, for example, when the source system is running a 64-bit version of Windows XP.

segment.source: For example, to set this system environment variable for a 32-bit architecture, at a command prompt type the following:
segment.target: For example, to set this system environment variable for a 32-bit architecture, at a command prompt type the following:

segment.source: Use an offline.xml file when running the ScanState tool on a computer that has multiple Windows directories.
segment.target: Use an offline.xml file when running the ScanState tool on a computer that has multiple Windows directories.

segment.source: The offline.xml file specifies which directories to scan for windows files.
segment.target: The offline.xml file specifies which directories to scan for windows files.

segment.source: An offline.xml file can be used with the /offline option as an alternative to specifying a single Windows directory path with the /offlineDir option.
segment.target: An offline.xml file can be used with the /offline option as an alternative to specifying a single Windows directory path with the /offlineDir option.

segment.source: This element contains other elements that define how an offline migration is to be performed.
segment.target: This element contains other elements that define how an offline migration is to be performed.

segment.source: This element is a required child of offline and contains information about how the offline volume can be selected.
segment.target: This element is a required child of offline and contains information about how the offline volume can be selected.

segment.source: The migration will be performed from the first element of winDir that contains a valid Windows system volume.
segment.target: The migration will be performed from the first element of winDir that contains a valid Windows system volume.

segment.source: This element is a required child of winDir and contains a file path pointing to a valid Windows directory.
segment.target: This element is a required child of winDir and contains a file path pointing to a valid Windows directory.

segment.source: Relative paths are interpreted from the ScanState tool’s working directory.
segment.target: Relative paths are interpreted from the ScanState tool’s working directory.

segment.source: Syntax, when used with the mappings element: path C:, D:/path
segment.target: Syntax, when used with the mappings element: path C:, D:/path

segment.source: This element is an optional child of offline.
segment.target: This element is an optional child of offline.

segment.source: When specified, the mappings element will override the automatically detected WinPE drive mappings.
segment.target: When specified, the mappings element will override the automatically detected WinPE drive mappings.

segment.source: Each child path element will provide a mapping from one system volume to another.
segment.target: Each child path element will provide a mapping from one system volume to another.

segment.source: Additionally, mappings between folders can be provided, since an entire volume can be mounted to a specific folder.
segment.target: Additionally, mappings between folders can be provided, since an entire volume can be mounted to a specific folder.

segment.source: This element is an optional child of offline.
segment.target: This element is an optional child of offline.

segment.source: The failOnMultipleWinDir element allows the user to specify that the migration should fail when USMT detects that there are multiple instances of Windows installed on the source machine.
segment.target: The failOnMultipleWinDir element allows the user to specify that the migration should fail when USMT detects that there are multiple instances of Windows installed on the source machine.

segment.source: When the failOnMultipleWinDir element isn’t present, the default behavior is that the migration does not fail.
segment.target: When the failOnMultipleWinDir element isn’t present, the default behavior is that the migration does not fail.

segment.source: The following XML example illustrates some of the elements discussed earlier in this topic.
segment.target: The following XML example illustrates some of the elements discussed earlier in this topic.
